ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, I ve noticed a few authors (some using NEAT and others not, eg Soltoggio) use a precision or granularity parameter for weight values, ie each weight

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Hi all,

I've noticed a few authors (some using NEAT and others not, eg Soltoggio)
use a precision or granularity parameter for weight values, ie each weight
may only adopt a value from a (fairly large) discrete set of values
determined by the granularity/precision parameter.

I've been wondering about the motivation behind this and whether I should
bother to implement it in my software. I can't actually come up with any
particularly compelling reasons for doing this (I'll put it down to lack of
sleep ;)). Could anyone enlighten me?

Cheers,
Oliver

--f46d043be24003837a04d349aad8
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
